text: Luisa de Medrano (1484–1527), was a Spanish scholar. She was born to Diego López de Medrano and Magdalena Bravo de Lagunas. She taught in Latin at the University of Salamanca, and replaced Antonio de Nebrija.Pedro de Torres: Cronicón, Salamanca, 1508. She wrote poems and philosophy, though her work has been lost. The Institute Lucia de Medrano was named after her. ==See also== * Beatriz Galindo * Francisca de Lebrija * Isabella Losa * Juliana Morell ==References== Category:1484 births Category:1527 deaths Category:16th-century Spanish people category:Spanish women philosophers
